title: How to Stop Hair Loss and Regrow Hair Naturally

steps.title: This could stimulate your hair follicles to produce more hair.
steps.content: This could stimulate your hair follicles to produce more hair. One study showed that a daily massage for 4 minutes increased hair thickness. Try rubbing your fingertips around your scalp for a few minutes each day to see if this helps. [1] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source This will probably take a while to work. The study took measurements after 24 weeks, or almost 6 months. You could also use a massage tool on your scalp.

steps.title: Stress has a definite impact and makes you lose hair faster.
steps.content: Stress has a definite impact and makes you lose hair faster. [2] X Expert Source Courtney Foster Licensed Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 9 December 2019. If you’ve been especially stressed and notice that you’re losing hair, then try to control your stress as soon as possible. Making some positive changes could reduce the hair loss. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Try making time each day for some relaxation exercises like meditation, deep breathing, or yoga. Doing things you enjoy is also good for fighting stress, so make some time for your hobbies each day as well. If you have trouble reducing your stress, then talking to a professional therapist or psychiatrist can be a big help.

steps.title: Smoking restricts circulation to your scalp and could cause hair loss.
steps.content: Smoking restricts circulation to your scalp and could cause hair loss. If you do smoke, then stop as soon as possible to avoid health problems. If you don’t smoke, then it’s best not to start at all. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Secondhand smoke can cause health problems as well, so don’t let anyone smoke in your home.

steps.title: Cleaning your hair is important, but harsh products can strip nutrients and oils.
steps.content: Cleaning your hair is important, but harsh products can strip nutrients and oils. [5] X Expert Source Courtney Foster Licensed Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 9 December 2019. Use a gentle, alcohol-free shampoo to preserve your hair’s nutrients. Then use a moisturizing conditioner every time you shampoo to keep your hair hydrated. [6] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Use products that are free of fragrances and alcohol. Products marked “Hypoallergenic” and designed for sensitive skin tend to work best. Using a leave-in conditioner can also protect your hair throughout the day.

steps.title: Constant brushing can damage your hair and scalp.
steps.content: Constant brushing can damage your hair and scalp. Only comb your hair enough to style it, then stop. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you have a habit of tugging on your hair during the day, then stop this as well. Any pressure could cause further hair loss.

steps.title: These treatments all use harsh chemicals that can strip your hair of nutrients.
steps.content: These treatments all use harsh chemicals that can strip your hair of nutrients. It’s best to avoid these treatments, and especially so if you’ve started losing your hair. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Heat from blow dryers or curling irons damage your hair with consistent use.
steps.content: Heat from blow dryers or curling irons damage your hair with consistent use. Avoid using these products as much as possible to avoid damaged and thinning hair. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Air-dry your hair as much as possible. If you use a blow dryer, keep it on a low heat setting. It’s fine to use curlers or straighteners occasionally. Just don’t do it every day.

steps.title: A simple blood test can confirm whether or not you’re missing any nutrients.
steps.content: A simple blood test can confirm whether or not you’re missing any nutrients. While nutrition can play a big role in hair growth, nutritional changes generally only work if you already have some kind of deficiency. If you’re losing your hair and don’t know why, then visit your doctor for a blood test. The results can tell you whether or not you need to make changes. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Unfortunately, dietary changes don’t make much of a difference if you don’t have any nutrient deficiencies. Some topical or medical treatments can still help.

steps.title: Eating too few calories can cause hair loss, like if you’re on an extreme or crash diet.
steps.content: Eating too few calories can cause hair loss, like if you’re on an extreme or crash diet. This can leave your body malnourished and unable to produce hair. Speak to your doctor to determine how many calories you need per day to stay healthy, and stick with that in your normal diet. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source In general, women can eat as few as 1,200 calories per day and men can go as low as 1,500 per day without any problems. Dropping below these levels could cause nutrient deficiencies. [12] X Trustworthy Source National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute Research and education center within the National Institutes of Health Go to source Be especially careful if you’re dieting. Track your calories so you don’t accidentally end up malnourished.

steps.title: Lack of iron is a common nutrient deficiency and can definitely lead to hair loss.
steps.content: Lack of iron is a common nutrient deficiency and can definitely lead to hair loss. If you’re iron-deficient, then redesign your diet or take supplements to get the recommended amount. [13] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source In general, men need 8 mg and women need 18 mg of iron each day. [14] X Research source Sources of iron include red and lean meat, fish, beans, nuts, legumes, and leafy green vegetables. You can also take an iron supplement if your doctor tells you this is safe.

steps.title: Adults need 8-11 mg of zinc each day.
steps.content: Adults need 8-11 mg of zinc each day. [15] X Research source Zinc helps your body produce enzymes that aid in hair growth, and deficiencies are associated with baldness. If you have a zinc deficiency, then you can get more from your diet or from dietary supplements. [16] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Good zinc sources include oysters and other shellfish, red meat and poultry, beans, nuts, whole grains, and dairy products. Zinc deficiencies are more common if you have some kind of digestive disorder like inflammatory bowel disease. It’s also possible if you’re a vegetarian or vegan.

steps.title: These fatty acids can support your follicle health and stimulate hair growth.
steps.content: These fatty acids can support your follicle health and stimulate hair growth. [17] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Good sources include fish and shellfish, seed and vegetable oils, nuts, beans, and soy. [18] X Trustworthy Source Oregon State University Linus Pauling Institute Research center dedicated to promoting optimal health through cutting-edge nutrition research and public outreach Go to source You could also get fatty acids from fish oil supplements, but these supplements’ impact on hair growth isn’t known yet.

steps.title: You only need about 25-30 mcg of biotin each day.
steps.content: You only need about 25-30 mcg of biotin each day. Biotin is a B vitamin that aids in hair growth. If you don’t have enough of this nutrient, then your hair could start thinning. Make sure you’re getting the right amount from your diet every day. [19] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source The best sources are organ meat, fish, eggs, seeds, nuts, and red meat. [20] X Research source Biotin deficiencies are pretty rare, so it’s unlikely that this is causing your hair loss.

steps.title: Selenium is a type of protein that definitely plays a role in hair growth.
steps.content: Selenium is a type of protein that definitely plays a role in hair growth. This is why a lot of hair growth formulas use it. However, eating too much selenium could cause selenium toxicity, which also causes hair loss. It’s best to get selenium from your regular diet instead of supplements to avoid having too much. [21] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Adults need about 55 mcg of selenium each day. You can get this from meat, poultry, eggs, dairy, and whole grains. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Too much of either nutrient in your system could actually cause hair loss.
steps.content: Too much of either nutrient in your system could actually cause hair loss. Keep your intake of each vitamin within the normal levels to avoid any problems. [23] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source It’s very hard to consume too many vitamins from your regular diet. The typical cause is overuse of supplements, so make sure you take all supplements exactly as directed.

steps.title: The most common brand of this medication is Rogaine.
steps.content: The most common brand of this medication is Rogaine. It comes in a foam or shampoo that you'd apply to your scalp once or twice a day, depending on the instructions. [24] X Expert Source Courtney Foster Licensed Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 9 December 2019. This can take up to 6 months to show results but is an effective treatment for hair loss. [25] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Rogaine is available without a prescription. Be careful and don't get the medication anywhere you don't want hair to grow.

steps.title: This is a common treatment for people with a few bald patches.
steps.content: This is a common treatment for people with a few bald patches. Steroid injections can reduce inflammation in your follicles and help them produce more hair. Your dermatologist can give you these injections every 4 to 8 weeks, so keep up with your appointments for the best results. [26] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source This treatment can show results within 12 weeks if you're consistent with your appointments.

steps.title: You might need several sessions a week for a few months before you see results.
steps.content: You might need several sessions a week for a few months before you see results. [27] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source It's possible that laser treatments can stimulate your hair follicles into producing more hair. These treatments are done in the dermatologist's office, so discuss the treatment with them if you'd like to try it. [28] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You can also use laser treatment alongside another treatment to stimulate hair growth like medication.

steps.title: Transplants work best if you still have some hair on your head.
steps.content: Transplants work best if you still have some hair on your head. A hair transplant takes some healthy follicles from a different part of your scalp and implants them in bald sections. A surgeon or dermatologist will apply local anesthesia to your scalp and then make the transplant. You can go home after your treatment is done. [29] X Research source Follow all of your doctor's instructions for post-op care for the best results. You might need follow-up surgeries to fill in leftover bare patches.
